timeline.message:
VersionLockedObject and CorfuTable Deadlock

This patch removes a circular dependency between threads acquiring
the VLO lock and threads used for parallel stream operations (i.e
scanAndFilter).

timeline.bodyText: Should this be a parameter ? or is this formula always good.
timeline.author: medhavidhawan

replies.bodyText:
This maintains the current behavior, which uses the common thread pool. The common thread pool uses # of cpus - 1.
I don't like it, but making this configurable is part of a bigger change to be able to pass a client context to different layers.
replies.author: Maithem

timeline.bodyText: I know i have seen this problem, but is there a way to create a test that will cause this deadlock. I am not holding the review for this but just want to see if something is possible.
timeline.author: medhavidhawan

replies.bodyText:
Its a timing issue and there isn't a lot of control over how threads access the VLO.
Let me think about how this can be tested.
replies.author: Maithem

replies.bodyText:
Without a test case it is hard to be convinced.
A small test may help such as with a thread pool of 4 and each start with try to hold a common lock, then the successful one will try to do parallel work, this could lead to a possible deadlock.
replies.author: xiaoqin2012

replies.bodyText:
This race condition is really tricky to reproduce because of timing. I wasn't able to do it with latches.
Apparent, the usage of parallel stream with the common fork-join pool has unspecified behavior
https://stackoverflow.com/a/29272776

replies.bodyText:
I didn't notice.
I'm going to change them to use keySet and values instead, because those two methods shouldn't be exposed by PersistedStreamingMap
